column2: What is a transformer?
column3: A Transformer is a model architecture used in natural language processing that relies entirely on an attention mechanism to draw global dependencies between input and output instead of recurrence. It allows for significantly more parallelization and can achieve state-of-the-art results in translation tasks while being trained much faster than architectures based on recurrent or convolutional layers. It is also being investigated for use in other tasks beyond text and for making generation less sequential.

column6: where θ is the angle between the two vectors
column7: and |A| and |B| are their magnitudes. The dot product is used in various applications such as projection
column8: finding the angle between two vectors
column9: and determining whether two vectors are orthogonal (perpendicular) to each other."

column2: "What is the process of passing an Amendment to the US Constitution?"
column3: "The process for passing an amendment to the US Constitution is outlined in Article V of the Constitution. It requires two steps: proposal and ratification. Proposal: An amendment can be proposed in two ways: a) By Congress: Two-thirds of both the House of Representatives and the Senate must vote in favor of the proposed amendment. b) By a Constitutional Convention: Two-thirds of the state legislatures can request Congress to call a Constitutional Convention to propose amendments. However
column4: this method has never been used. Ratification: After an amendment is proposed
column5: it must be ratified by three-fourths of the state legislatures or by special state conventions. The method of ratification is determined by Congress when proposing the amendment. Once an amendment is ratified by the required number of states
column6: it becomes part of the Constitution."

column2: "How can Congress override a Presidential veto?"
column3: "Congress can override a Presidential veto by obtaining a two-thirds majority vote in both the House of Representatives and the Senate. If the bill is vetoed by the President
column4: it is sent back to Congress. If two-thirds of both houses vote in favor of the bill
column5: it becomes a law despite the President's veto."

column2: "Can a President override legislation that Congress passes?"

column5: which means rejecting it and sending it back to Congress with their objections. However
column6: Congress can override a presidential veto by a two-thirds majority vote in both the Senate and the House of Representatives."

column2: What is a surface integral?
column3: A surface integral is a type of integral that is used to calculate the flux of a vector field across a surface. It involves integrating a function over a surface in three-dimensional space. The surface integral can be thought of as summing up the contributions of the function over infinitesimally small areas on the surface. The result of the surface integral gives a scalar value that represents the total amount of the function that passes through the surface.

column2: Summarize Reconstruction in under 4 sentences
column3: "Reconstruction was a period of rebuilding in the United States after the Civil War. It aimed to restore the Southern states to the Union and address the rights and freedoms of African Americans. President Andrew Johnson favored a lenient approach
column4: while Radical Republicans in Congress sought a more comprehensive and strict reconstruction plan. Ultimately
column5: Congress took control of Reconstruction and implemented policies to protect the rights of African Americans."

column2: Was Abraham Lincoln a representative in the US House?
column3: "Yes
column4: Abraham Lincoln served one term in the U.S. House of Representatives."
column5: Uses Open AI

column2: Why was Andrew Johnson VP for Lincoln in the 1864 presidential election?
column3: "President Lincoln chose Andrew Johnson as his vice president in the 1864 presidential election because Johnson was a Democrat and Lincoln was a Republican. Lincoln wanted to show that he was willing to work with Democrats and promote unity during the Civil War. Additionally
column4: Johnson's strong belief in the Union and his opposition to slavery made him an appealing choice for Lincoln."
column5: Correct Answer

column2: Summarize who the Radical Republicans were in under 4 sentences
column3: "The Radical Republicans were a group of politicians during the Reconstruction era in the United States. They believed in full equality for African Americans and wanted to ensure that their rights were protected. They wanted to ""get to the root of the problem"" by changing the laws of the South and the nation. Their goals included punishing Southerners who had supported the rebellion against the United States and ensuring that African Americans had the right to vote and hold office. They also wanted to put these rights into the U.S. Constitution to protect them from being taken away."
